TopicTitle: [1.7.1][1.8.1][1.9.1][1.10.1] Persistent Thrust Extended 1.7.5 (now with background persistent thrust)

Articles.Content: New Update Broke the Solid Rocket Boosters. Just a heads up. Had to uninstall and validate that it is P.T. 1.5 Now, I do not know if it has to do with interaction with any other mods I have. I will paste a List of mods I am using and if so I apologize. I did try stock boosters as well and they where not working with it either. I have not tried pure stock game with just P.T. 1.5 I also used Ckan to install.

53 minutes ago, PCkarma112 said:

Broke the Solid Rocket Boosters.

Could you be more specific, exactly which solid rocket booster. Have you tried the latest version?

Edited July 10, 2020 by FreeThinker

Version 1.6.1 for Kerbal Space Program 1.8.1 - 1.10

Released on 2020-07-10

  • Compatible with KSP 1.8.1 - KSP 1.10
  • Added power consumption display
  • Fixed some consumption inconsistencies with multi-engine effects

11 hours ago, FreeThinker said:

Could you be more specific, exactly which solid rocket booster. Have you tried the latest version?

Sure, I tested the "Flea" SRB-12-01, "Hammer" SRB-12-02,  "Mite" SRB-06-03, "Thumper" SRB-12-06. Those were stock. I tested SRM-L, SRM-S, SRM-XL From Sounding Rockets Mod. After that I uninstalled P.T. and they worked again. I Did update P.T. from Ckan as far as I know it was P.T. 1.6.0 I had installed because I had just updated this specific mod (P.T.) before starting game and seeing that my boosters stopped working. hey would fire up, but only with smoke from what I could ell and sound. Using Mechjeb I could see it was showing here was an actual thrust coming from all boosters I tested but game refused to recognize this  for some reason (no actual lifting off even with 3.3 TWR).  Again, I may be mistaken and it more than likely is interaction with any one of a number of my mods listed below. I will go ahead and try again with P.T. 1.6.1 or see if I can revert back to P.T. 1.5.4 which for some reason had zero problems with these other mods and worked well hehe. Im sorry if none of this helps or if it is not an recreateable issue. Thank you for your time and amazing mod!

Ok, so downloaded newest version 1.6.1 and tried to recreate using all the same parts I listed and now everything is working fine! So, I am honestly not sure what had happened.. I am definitely glad it is working though! I thank you for all the help and I am sorry as well for any waste of time if it happens again I will try reloading KSP next time and double checking and will save any logs and Screenshot as well.. So, my apologies a s well..

@PCkarma112

I'd revist each mods page and review the dependencies, if I were you.

You should probably be running ModularFuelTanks.

You def need to reinstall TweakScale and B9.

There are a mess of "as it can't satisfy its NEEDS" for things that SHOULD be satisfied like B9

Also, go here and get missing models (fuelTankJumbo-64) for SpaceY .
On it! Thank you SO much!

What's the differences between "BetterTimeWarp" and this ?

1 hour ago, 某事不过三兄 said:

What's the differences between "BetterTimeWarp" and this ?

This allows you to use your engines during timewarp.  BTW handles the timewarping.

1 hour ago, 某事不过三兄 said:

What's the differences between "BetterTimeWarp" and this ?

They work great in conjunction. In fact I would recommend you use them together for best results
